result.execSummary:
The defendant Sarah W. Bear was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sarah W. Bear

defendant.name: Bear, Sarah W.
defendant.address: N4070 E. Lake Lane, White Lake, WI 54491

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Sarah W. Bear in court with attorney Peter J. Prusinski.  Defendant Sarah W. Bear in custody.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF151, 15CF152, 15CF177 and 16CM94 @ 10:21 a.m. Agreement stated - 16CM94 restitution of $288 already paid, will plead to charge, costs. 15CF177 - Information filed. Def will plead to ct 2, dismiss and read in other counts, withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, costs. 15CF152 - plead to ct 2, dismiss and read in ct 1, withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, AODA (on all), costs. 15CF151 - plead to ct 1, ct 2 dismiss and read in, withheld sentence, 2 yrs probation, 10 days jail, costs, agrees to bond forf.  Atty Prusinski agrees, notes that 15CF177 was amended to misd. Def agrees with stated agreement. 15CF177 ct 2 amended to misd bail jumping 946.49(1)(a) by stipulation. Plea quest. reviewed. 15CF151 ct 1 - guilty plea. Court grants motion to dismiss and read in ct 2. 16CM94 ct 1 - guilty plea. 15CF152 ct 2 - guilty plea. Court grants motion to dismiss and read in ct 1. 15CF177 ct 2 as amended - guilty plea. Court grants motion to dismiss and read in cts 1 & 3. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Prusinski satisfied. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas and finds guilty of 15CF151 ct 1 obstructing an officer, 16CM94 issue worthless check, 15CF152 ct 2 possess THC and 15CF177 ct 2 misd bail jumping. Sentencing remarks by Counsel. State has complied with victim rights. Atty Prusinski requests 30 days to submit stipulation regarding sentence credit. Nothing by Defendant. Remarks by the Court. 15CF151 ct 1 withheld sentence, 2 yrs probation, 10 days jail, consecutive to any other jail time, court costs, DNA surcharge, reserve right to argue credit if revoked. Bond is forfeited to County. 16CM94 ct 1 - court costs, DNA surcharge. Apply bond from 15CF177. Pmt plan for balance if needed. 15CF152 ct 2 - withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, court costs, AODA and follow through, DNA surcharge. No credit ordered at this time on any probations if revoked. Reserve right. 15CF177 ct 2 - withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, AODA and follow through, court costs, DNA surcharge.  Huber on jail. May be served in any county. No electronic monitoring. Report no later than 7 p.m. on 1/30/17. Huber according to that jail's policies. DNA sample has already been given.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Postconviction rights. If any balance left of 15CF177 bond, apply to costs on that case.
Ad Prosequendum and Order to Institution (filed in 15-CF-151)

Defendant Sarah W. Bear in court with attorney Peter Joseph Prusinski.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint received, waive reading.  Reserve jurisdictional objections.  Signature bond has been set.  Not guilty plea entered.  All cases 15CF151, 15CF152, & 15CF177 will be called on status conf date.  Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
and Defendant's Motion to Extend Time to File Pre-Trial Motions - filed in 15-CF-151
Adjourned initial appearance on August 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Sarah W. Bear not in court.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 2:26 pm.  Court receive valid doctor excuse.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Sarah W. Bear in court.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Called at 2:22pm  Def has copy of complaint.  Court reviews charge with possible penalties.  Def advised of right to an atty.  Def can contact public defender, hire an atty, or court appointed.  Def indicates matter has been taken care of.  Court instructs def if she wants to make an appointment with DA's office.  State request signature bond, and indicates matter is paid.   Bond set by court  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
